@ScottAdamsSays @CNNPolitics I'll remember that if I ever start selling used cars. "Oh sure, the brakes on this car are great ... yep, driven exclusively by a little old lady on Sundays to go to church." Only persuasion matters; we don't need no stinking facts. Or ethics.

@ScottAdamsSays @CNNPolitics Perhaps the moral compass isnt working on moral landscape devoid of road signs or even landmarks.
Ask your plumber, he’s bopping underaged kids....
@ScottAdamsSays @CNNPolitics This isn't a matter of persuasion.  It's clear, even to Stevie Wonder, that the left is grasping at straws.  I'd say it's persuasion if they had something on Trump.
@cover81 @ScottAdamsSays @CNNPolitics Well, he’s the President so obviously, you’re wrong.

@ScottAdamsSays @CNNPolitics So, CNN has been fully on board with a Democrat and MSM News (but, I repeat myself) trial of Trump, in the court of public opinion, supported by exactly no relevant facts, since the election, without knowing that this "isn't a legal fight, it's a public relations one"?
@ScottAdamsSays @CNNPolitics Sorry to break this to you, pal. But Trump and Rudy aren't even one bit persuasive to 60% of America. They're good at persuading their rubes. That's it.
@ScottAdamsSays @CNNPolitics "Trump is beating us at our own game, and we don't like it one little bit."—CNN
@ScottAdamsSays @CNNPolitics Slow learners.
